title: Roman Double Stoa
description: A two-aisled Doric stoa ran along the south side of the Panathenaic Way from the Stoa Basileios towards the Dipylon Gate, which contained shops. It was constructed over a long period beginning in the early second century BC and repeatedly modified. The building was destroyed in the Herulian Sack of 267 AD, rebuilt, damaged in the Gothic Sack of 396 AD, rebuilt again, and was finally destroyed in the Slavic Sack of 582 AD.

properties.description: The stoa was traced in archaeological excavations in 1936, 1939, and 1970 for a distance of 76 metres from its southeastern end. It is unknown how much further in extended to the northwest.
properties.title: Google Maps: Representative location of Roman Double Stoa
